Package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.binding.model.property

Interface PropertyBinding

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    AssemblyPropertyBinding, FieldPropertyBinding, FieldValuePropertyBinding, FlagPropertyBinding, ModelItemPropertyBinding, NamedPropertyBinding
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractModelItemPropertyBinding, AbstractPropertyBinding, DefaultAssemblyPropertyBinding, DefaultFieldPropertyBinding, DefaultFieldValuePropertyBinding, DefaultFlagPropertyBinding
    public interface PropertyBinding
    Represents a property (field or method) on a Java class that is bound to a Metaschema object (i.e., Assembly, Field, or Flag).

    Properties are bound to constructs in XML and JSON/YAML formats.

    In XML key characteristics of a property binding include:

    • The name and namespace of the property which will be used for the associated element or attribute provided by the getXmlQName() method.

    In JSON/YAML key characteristics of a property binding include:

    • A string-based key representing the field name of a JSON/YAML object

    • Method Detail

      • getPropertyBindingType

        PropertyBindingType getPropertyBindingType()

      • getXmlQName

        javax.xml.namespace.QName getXmlQName()
        Identifies the QName to use for the element or attribute associated with this property in an XML serialization.

        The QName value returned will be based on the type of binding identified by getPropertyBindingType() as follows:

        • PropertyBindingType.FLAG: the QName of the attribute will be provided based on the bound Flag annotation using the Flag.name() and Flag.namespace().
        • PropertyBindingType.FIELD: the QName of the element will be provided based on the bound Field annotation using the Field.name() and Field.namespace().
        • PropertyBindingType.ASSEMBLY: the QName of the element will be provided based on the bound Assembly annotation using the Assembly.name() and Assembly.namespace().
        • PropertyBindingType.FIELD_VALUE: the QName will be null, since the property is bound based on the FieldValue annotation. In such a case contents of this property are not wrapped by an element, but are instead the contents of the outer Field's element.
        Returns:
        the QName for the bound element or attribute, or null if the property is based on a FieldValue annotation

      • getJsonFieldName

        java.lang.String getJsonFieldName​(BindingContext bindingContext)
                           throws BindingException
        Identifies the name to use for the field associated with this property in a JSON or YAML serialization.

        The name value returned will be based on the type of binding identified by getPropertyBindingType().

        When getPropertyBindingType() == PropertyBindingType.FLAG, the name of the field will be provided based on the bound Flag annotation using the Flag.name() and Flag.namespace().

        When getPropertyBindingType() == PropertyBindingType.ASSEMBLY or getPropertyBindingType() == PropertyBindingType.FIELD, one of two possible states can occur:

        • If the GroupAs annotation is present, then the name value will be the value of GroupAs.name().
        • Otherwise, the name value will be the value of Assembly.name() or Field.name() respectively.

        When getPropertyBindingType() == PropertyBindingType.FIELD_VALUE, the field name value is determined as follows (in order):

        • If the JsonFieldValueKey annotation is present on any sibling Flag, then the field name is null. The name must be determined by analyzing an remaining properties to parse the flag's value and the field value.
        • Else if the JsonFieldValueName annotation is present on the property, then the field name is the value of JsonFieldValueName.name().
        • Otherwise, the field name is determined by the bound type of the property using the JavaTypeAdapter.getDefaultJsonFieldName().

        Note: Use of the JsonFieldValueName and JsonFieldValueKey annotations are mutually exclusive.

        Parameters:
        bindingContext - the configured binding context that initialized this property
        Returns:
        the JSON field name
        Throws:
        BindingException - if a binding error has occured

      • getPropertyInfo

        PropertyInfo getPropertyInfo()
        Gets information about the bound property.
        Returns:
        the property information for the bound property

      • newXmlPropertyParser

        XmlPropertyParser newXmlPropertyParser​(BindingContext bindingContext)
                                throws BindingException
        Throws:
        BindingException
